metadata.Title: CVE-2017-6542 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description: The ssh_agent_channel_data function in PuTTY before 0.68 allows remote attackers to have unspecified impact via a large length value in an agent protocol message and leveraging the ability to connect to the Unix-domain socket representing the forwarded agent connection, which trigger a buffer overflow.

criterions.comment: putty: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
